work.synopsis: A cookery book designed to allow children themselves to take the lead, with fun and healthy ideas for all sorts of food they can make themselves, with the added bonus of teaching them the basics of cookery in the process. Each tested recipe is in easy-to-follow steps and illustrated in colour.

work.author: Eileen Tucker Cosby, Michelle, M.D. May
work.synopsis: "H" is for HEALTHY - Weight Management for Kids, is the fifth in the series featuring Jorjak, Marisk, Ratak and Pattiwak, collectively known as Our KidsPak.  In this book, our energetic group of characters teach children that healthy living can be fun!  Choosing to have a healthy lifestyle and feeling good about yourself is a way that we can adopt a new attitude and adopt a new way of life.  This book includes Spanish translation.
work.title: "H" is for Healthy: Weight Management for Kids

work.author: National Geographic
work.basic: Juvenile Nonfiction / Science & Nature / Earth Sciences / General # Juvenile Nonfiction / Reference / Atlases
work.synopsis: The paperback edition of the award-winning "National Geographic World Atlas for Young Explorers" features vibrant photographs, maps, and graphics; completely updated essays and statistics; 32 thematic map spreads on topics such as environmental hot spots, world religions, world food, world water, world energy and mineral resources; illustrated regional map spreads; more than 200 full-colour illustrations; 115-plus pages of full-size National Geographic maps; updated country fact boxes; an alphabetical listing of flags of the world; comprehensive place-name index with coordinates for easy reference; and, expanded glossary of geographic terms. A dramatic new and specially designed web site will allow kids to link directly to hundreds of National Geographic maps, photographs, and articles plus videos, music, languages, crafts, quizzes, and more that will expand their knowledge and perspective about the material featured in the atlas and about the world itself. All maps are shown in the context of surrounding areas to ensure that a full picture of the world develops. Same-size physical and political maps make for easy comparisons and help youngsters understand how physical features influence patterns of human settlement and economic activity. Stunning images from space help link real-world images and cartography. Throughout, locator globes and colour-coding make it easy for kids to keep track of where they are and to quickly navigate from one continent or region to another.
work.title: "National Geographic" Kids World Atlas
